system.description:
A crystal in the shape of a long, rough prism. Three command words cause the crystal to emit three different types of light.

  • Charges: The gem has 50 charges.

  • Beam: A beam of pale light, 10’ long and 2’ wide. Consumes no charges.

  • Ray: A momentary ray of bright light, 50’ long and 1’ wide to be directed at the eyes of a creature. The target must save versus spells or be blinded for [[/r 1d4]] rounds. Expends 1 charge.

  • Flash: A momentary cone of blinding light, 30’ long and 5’ wide at the end. All creatures in the cone must save versus spells or be blinded for [[/r 1d4]] rounds and suffer a permanent penalty to attack rolls equal to the number of rounds of blindness. The attack penalty can only be cured by powerful magic (e.g. @UUID[Compendium.ose-advancedfantasytome.spells.Item.eLs98lY26KQujnE4]{cure serious wounds} cast expressly for the purpose). Expends 5 charges.

  • Magical darkness: Negates the effects of the gem.
